snippet: Megan J. Smith, an M.I.T.-trained mechanical engineer and former Google executive, is trying to bring her Silicon Valley sensibility to the Obama administration.
abstract: Profile of Megan J Smith, MIT-trained mechanical engineer and former Google executive who is first woman to hold job as chief technology officer of the United States; Smith's goal within Obama administration is to update technology in federal bureaucracy that still uses floppy disks.
lead_paragraph: Megan J. Smith, an M.I.T.-trained mechanical engineer and former Google executive, is trying to bring her Silicon Valley sensibility to the Obama administration.

headline.main: Adviser Guides Obama Into the Google Age
headline.print_headline: Her Task: Weaning White House Off Floppy Disks
